\u2018Thar Desert expanding since last 2.description: JAIPUR: The Thar Desert in Rajasthan is expanding with every passing year since the last 20 years towards a man-made catastrophe. A report by Central Arid Zone Research Institute (CAZRI) reveals that the spurt in economic activities in the desert districts has shattered the fragile landscape, impacting its residents directly. CAZRI shared the report to mark the World Day to Combat Desertification on June 17. This was compiled using multiple independent studies including the Indian Remote Sensing Satellite data 2015-16. The report made the astonishing claim that 14.88-million-hectare land in 12 western Rajasthan districts suffered from different kinds of land degradation contributing to desertification. The report has studied the features of desertification: wind erosion / deposition, water erosion, salinity/ alkalinity, waterlogging and vegetation degradation to conclude that the situation may take decades to reverse the damage. The report studied districts of Barmer, Bikaner, Jaisalmer, Churu, Ganganagar, Hanumangarh, Jodhpur, Jalore, Jhunjhunu, Nagaur, Pali and Sikar. “The biggest reason contributing to desertification turned out to be water erosion. Our report suggested that 64.69% mapped area is facing wind erosion. For instance, 10% of land degradation in districts like Barmer, Jaisalmer and Jodhpur is due to water erosion,” said O P Yadav, director, CAZRI. Explaining the reason why the sandy landscape existing from millions of years is facing the change only in the last few decades, the report explained that such landscapes are highly vulnerable to wind erosion and it is a universal phenomenon. “What made the situation worse is human-induced activities like fast urbanization, deforestation, mining, indiscriminate use of groundwater, rise in livestock population and the hot summers leading to evaporation. This has accelerated desertification,” said Yadav. Supporting their claim, the scientist says that western Rajasthan harbours a total domestic livestock population of nearly 30.18 million heads – an increase of 14.63 million heads (94.72%) over the 1956 Census figures. “The destruction of vegetative cover due to overgrazing, felling of trees, etc. have accelerated the removal of sediments from the catchment areas of waterbodies as well as loosening of farm soil,” said Yadav. Large-scale mining has been mapped in Jhunjhunu, Jalore, Jodhpur, Barmer for the minerals and building materials, which has impacted the equilibrium. The vegetation cover has gone forever, making the land vulnerable. The report added that the overall scenario has affected the agricultural productivity to a great extent. The introduction of water intensive and multiple crops have their adverse effects in the region. “The empirical data is still being collected to give exact mass land converted into desert,” said Yadav. The team of scientists are also accessing the damage being caused due to increasing vehicular traffic, construction of roads and canal and exploration of oil and gas. Rajasthan to hire over 250 medical teach.description: JAIPUR: Medical education department will soon start recruitment of 269 faculty members for its medical colleges along with the recruitment of paramedical staff for 428 posts and 746 nursing posts. A high-level meeting was held under health minister Raghu Sharma in the city on Monday. Apart from filling vacant posts of teaching staff in medical colleges, the medical education department is all set to boost research in state colleges. For the purpose, multi-disciplinary research units (MDRU) have already been established in Jaipur, Jodhpur, Bikaner and Udaipur, said Sharma. He said that such MDRU will also come up in government medical colleges of Kota, Ajmer and Rajasthan University of Health Sciences. Besides, proposals have also been sent for establishing MDRUs in new medical colleges of the state in Pali, Dungarpur, Bharatpur, Bhilwara and Churu. The number of post-graduation seats in medical colleges have also been increased in the state. “We have received approval to increase 46 PG seats in medical colleges of Jodhpur and Jaipur. Besides, for increasing PG seats in other government medical colleges, proposals will be sent to the Centre,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, cops to keep an eye on pollution in.description: JODHPUR: Now, police will be keeping an eye on the untreated effluent discharge by the industrial units into any open drain, in nature and specifically in Jojari river in Jodhpur. NGT has given directions now to the DGP of the state to form a task force to act on errant industry owners, not abiding by the directions of the NGT time to time. In its recent order pertaining to the industrial pollution of Jojari river, which has fallen an abject victim of untreated industrial discharge and sludge disposal, the bench of NGT headed by Justice S Raghvendra Rathore gave these directions to the DGP who had been summoned by the tribunal. The task force, which will have an ASP, four sub-inspectors, three head constables and 21 constables, will work in three shifts from its fully dedicated separate office close to the industrial area. “The task force will submit its report to the ADG on daily basis and the ADG will submit a comprehensive report to the NGT on monthly basis,” the order said. The order has come after the incessant non-compliance of the tribunal’s directions to the industrialists to treat the industrial effluent at the CETP before discharging it into open and failure of the pollution control board and other agencies to monitor these units and ensure compliance of the directions of the tribunal. The task force will have the responsibility to take action against any unit discharging its effluent and sludge into open or in any natural source of water like Jojari river. The task force will have power to seal such units and such sealed units will not be able to resume work only after the permission of the NGT. The task force will also check the unit for absence of any permit or formality. Even the vehicle, used by the unit in transporting the sludge to be disposed of in any open area, will be seized by the task force and would be subject to the permission of the NGT for release. It may be noted that the hearing in the NGT has been taking place against pollution by way of discharge of untreated effluent of the tie and die industries in Jodhpur, Balotra and Pali, which has devastated not only the ecology of the region but has threatened the existence of Jojri, Luni and Bandi rivers respectively. Pre-monsoon showers bring down heat in s.description: JAIPUR: Japurites took a sigh of relief from scorching heat with the moderate pre-monsoon rainfall on Tuesday. The temperature of the Pink City came down to 29.8 degree Celsius on Tuesday from 44 degree Celsius last week when people were reportedly suffering from heat stroke. Jaipur remained one of the ‘coldest’ cities in the state on Tuesday with 13.8 mm rainfall and minimum temperature of 22 degree Celsius. Highest temperature is recorded in Bikaner at 40.8 degree Celsius with zero rainfall. Roads of the Pink City remained clogged on Tuesday with heavy traffic jam and over flowing nullahs were seen around the city. Residents around the city complained that JMC officials were not prepared about the monsoon that will soon knock on the city doors. In next 24 hours there will be light to moderate rain accompanied with thunderstorm with gusty wind (30 - 40 kmph). Maximum and minimum temperature in Jaipur is likely to be around 31 degree Celsius to 24 degree Celsius respectively. Apart from Bikaner, most of the city of Rajasthan recorded zero mm rainfall including Kota, Jaisalmer, Sriganganagar and others. Mercury settled at 35.2 degree Celsius, 35.5 degree Celsius, 36.6 degree Celsius in Ajmer, Jodhpur and Sri Ganganagar respectively. As per the meteorological department, heavy rainfall is likely to occur in isolated places in gRajasthan. Moreover, in East Rajasthan, thunderstorm (30 kmph to 40 kmph) likely to occur in next 24 hours. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Four-yr-old girl who fell into 400-ft bo.description: JODHPUR: Four-year-old girl, Seema, who had fallen into a deep borewell in an agricultural farm in village Melana of Baori subdivision of Jodhpur on Monday evening, could not be saved. Her body was extracted from the borewell on Tuesday morning, after 14 hours of her falling into the borewell, and handed over to the family members. “Despite all efforts, we could not take the girl out of the borewell. Her body was taken out on Tuesday around 7.30am,” said an administrative official. He said that a compensation of Rs one lakh from the chief minister relief fund has been given to the parents of the girl. Seema had fallen into a 400-feet deep borewell on Monday at about 5.30pm and had gotten stuck at the depth of 260 feet. Initially, the sound of her crying could be easily heard but the sound gradually kept dying and completely stopped at around midnight. “In order to keep her alive and meet the shortage of oxygen down there, we made arrangements to pump in the oxygen from an ambulance, parallel with the rescue operation,” said the officer. Two earth moving machines had also been roped in to dig around the borewell but the rocky formations at the depth of 40 feet hampered the operation, after which the digging had to stop. After the rescue teams and officials came to the conclusion that the girl was no more, a rope with a tool which could stick in her clothes or body parts, was dropped in the borewell. After some efforts, her body was taken out. It may be noted that the tube well at the farm had broken down on Monday afternoon and the owner of the farm had taken the pump out for repairing, thereby leaving the borewell open, which finally turned out to be disastrous for his own daughter, who was playing around the farm and fell into it. At 33.1\u00b0C, Jaipur logs warmest morn.description: JAIPUR: The state remained under the grip of severe heatwave conditions for the fourth consecutive day on Friday with majority of places witnessing maximum temperatures of above 44 degree Celsius. Sriganganagar witnessed the hottest day of the season so far, reporting a maximum temperature of 49.6 degree Celsius. Jaipur witnessed the warmest morning of the season so far, recording a minimum temperature of 33.1 degree Celsius. Attributing the continued rise in the temperatures to northerly winds, Jaipur Met office said that the absence of any weather systems, including upper air cyclonic circulation and western disturbances, the heatwave conditions will further aggravate in the western Rajasthan. However, the rest of the state may witness a minor respite. In Jaipur, people woke up to the warmest morning of the season as the city recorded a minimum temperature of 33.1 degree Celsius. Since Thursday evening, the technicians of Jaipur Vidyut Vitaran Nigam Limited (JVVNL) were receiving phone calls on power failures that have continued till Friday morning. “Excess load has been the reason for continued tripping. Whereever problems occurred, our team rushed and rectified it,” said an engineer of the JVVNL to TOI. The continued rise in mercury has also increased the water crisis in the city. Many colonies are getting water supplied from tankers. In the afternoon, a maximum temperature rose to 44.2 degree Celsius. Though cloudy conditions prevailed across the city, there was no rainfall. In the evening, the mobile phone apps providing weather details were showing a minimum temperature above 30 degree Celsius. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Engineering stream likely to fill 50% se.description: JAIPUR: Engineering colleges are expecting to fill 50% seats in Rajasthan. Rajasthan Engineering Admission Process(REAP) are upbeat over the responses in the ongoing admission process. Last year, for around 40,000 seats, less than 15,000 applications were received. Till June 7, the body has received 7000 applications against the figure of 2000 last year in the first seven days of the admission process. As per experts, one of the reasons for less number of applicants last year was lower awareness among students regarding the examination and its benefits. This year, officials said that they have been promoting the examination by advertising on radio, television, newspapers and even sent officials to promote it within government school students. Sandeep Kumar, convener of the REAP, 2019 examination, said, “Last date of filling the form is June 29. Till June 7, we have already received 7,000 applications and the number is increasing every day. This is really a positive sign as last year by this date only 2,000 forms were received.” Due to the low turnout of students, government has been attempting various methods to attract more students. In 2017, one of the reasons for less number of applicants was the condition to deposit of advance amount of Rs 10,000 (refundable) along with the form fees of Rs 700. However, this was changed in 2018 and students were able to directly apply by depositing form fees. Earlier, exam was conducted for selection but now candidates are selected on the basis of JEE Mains and Advance rank An institute round is also conducted for any remaining seats where students can directly apply to the college of their choice. An official on condition of anonymity said that less number of students are opting for engineering because of low rate of placements in the field. “In Rajasthan, students opt for civil, electrical and mechanical engineering due to the scope available in government jobs. In other branches of engineering, placements are not as good as most companies prefer to hire engineers from Bangalore and there is no mechanism to hire graduates from Rajasthan colleges,” said the official. For mechanical engineering, equipment is costlier than other streams, hence, investment in infrastructure is poor. Punneet Sharma, an academician said that this year the trend is shifting and serious students are opting for Computer Science and Information technology due to the new developments in Artificial Intelligence. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Jodhpur discom initiates three-day feedb.description: JODHPUR: All ranks of Jodhpur discom have stepped out of the office for three days to collect consumer feedback. Over 1,000 officers, right from the MD to the junior engineers, have been going around the villages under the discom jurisdiction, taking feedback of the services from the people. “The objective of this initiative is to take feedback from the consumers about electricity services and to improve them further,” said the MD (Jodhpur discom), Avinash Singhvi. These officers left their offices on Tuesday and will continue to meet and talk to the consumers till Thursday, and will also be addressing the shortcomings like loose wires and cables as well as bent or weak electricity poles, apart from other risk indicators. It may be noted that chief minister Ashok Gehlot had expressed his displeasure over the derailed electricity supply in the state, following which the chairman of the discom, Naresh Pal Gangwar had held a meeting with the officials through video conferencing and had directed the officials to take to field for three days, to take stock of the situation and feedback from the consumers. Gehlot had said that it was the duty of the government to ensure better power supply to the consumers across the state and resolution of their grievances related to electricity without any delay. These officers will be checking the power supply conditions, CMR of 11 kv feeders, actual data of power supply by feeder monitoring with respect to single phase and triple phase supply etc. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Sachin Pilot should replace Ashok Gehlot.description: JAIPUR: Infighting in the state Congress intensified as party’s Todabhim MLA Prithviraj Meena on Wednesday demanded replacing CM Ashok Gehlot with his deputy Sachin Pilot. Meena further asked the CM to take up responsibility for party’s rout in the state in the Lok Sabha elections. Meena’s remark comes in the wake of Gehlot’s recent statement that Pradesh Congress Committee (PCC) chief Sachin Pilot should take responsibility for his son Vaibhav Gehlot’s defeat from Jodhpur. “A CM is responsible for an election defeat when the party is in power. When it is in the opposition, the responsibility lies with the party president. Of course, Ashok Gehlotji is responsible (for the debacle),” Meena told reporters on Wednesday. My personal opinion: MLA “After the assembly elections, I had said Sachin Pilot should become the chief minister. I have nothing to do with Pilot, but I said this because it was because of him that we got the majority. Out of the 46 seats in east Rajasthan, we won 43 seats. Ashok Gehlot doesn’t have influence on people anymore. There is no public liking for him. The Jats, Meenas, Gurjars are angry (with Gehlot), then who will give votes,” he asked. The MLA, however, said that it was his personal opinion that Pilot should be made the chief minister. “He (Gehlot) was the chief minister twice before. But after that, we got 56 and 21 seats (after assembly elections in 2003 and 2013). Only the person who can win votes and work for the the development of the state should be made the chief minister. He (Gehlot) has been the CM twice, now a new person should be made the chief minister. This is my personal view,” said Meena. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan: Rescue operation on to save 6.description: JAIPUR: Rescue work is in progress in Melana village of Baori block of Jodhpur where a six-year-old girl fell into a nearly 350-feet-deep borewell on Monday evening. The incident happened at around 6.30pm when the girl accidentally fell into the borewell. The villagers told the rescue teams that repair work of the borewell was undergoing when the incident happened. A team of doctors was called at the spot to provide support to the girl trapped inside the borewell. “We have arranged a pipe, which is more than 300-feet long and thrown it in the borewell. The pipe is connected to oxygen cylinders placed in an ambulance. We are ensuring that the girl should get proper oxygen supply, while disaster relief department teams are making efforts to rescue her,” said Dr Balwant Manda, chief medical health officer (CMHO), Jodhpur. However, the rescue team is slightly worried about health of the girl. “Initially, we were hearing sounds of cry of the girl for the past one hour but now we are not hearing sounds of her cry,” said an official involved in rescue work of the girl. Besides, the rescue team is trying to find out how deep in the borewell the girl is trapped. They are using earth movers to dig a parallel hole to reach to the trapped girl. Heatwave unabated in Rajasthan; Sriganga.description: JAIPUR: Heatwave conditions continued to prevail in Rajasthan for the third consecutive day on Thursday. Sriganganagar witnessed the hottest day of the season with temperatures rising to 48 degree Celsius. Jaipur recorded 32.2 degree Celsius, almost 5 degrees above the normal notch. It was followed by a simmering afternoon as the maximum temperature was recorded at 45.2 degree Celsius. In the past three days, the footfall of the patients complaining of heat stroke, diarrhoea and even food poisoning have increased. Doctors are advising patients to increase the intake of water having some salt and sugar in it in order to stay hydrated. In the afternoon roads wore an empty look as people confined themselves to their respective homes and offices. In the evening people thronged at juice corners and refreshed themselves with chilled beverages. The continued rise in the mercury also increased the work of the technicians of the Jaipur Vidyut Vitaran Nigam Limited(JVVNL). “Since Wednesday evening to Thursday morning, we have attended almost 100 calls of abrupt power cuts in various localities. Due to extra load electricity tripped,” said an officer. Many people were going through various apps on their phones to check the weather conditions. “Even at 10.30am the maximum temperature in Jaipur was 44 degree Celsius as per the details through various apps giving,” said Manoj Tanwani who was returning after a walk at Central Park in Jaipur. Sriganganagar was followed by Churu where the maximum temperature was recorded at 47.7 degree Celsius, Bikaner - 47.0, Jaisalmer - 45.7, Kota - 45.4, Jodhpur - 44.6, Barmer - 44, Ajmer 43.8 and 42.8 degree Celsius in Udaipur. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Act against SHO for not complying with c.description: JODHPUR: Rajasthan High Court has given directions to the DGP to take disciplinary action against an SHO from Nagaur district for not complying with the court’s directions and exercising negligence in discharge of his duty. The division bench of Justice Sandeep Mehta and Justice Vineet Kumar Mathur gave these directions while hearing a habeas corpus petition raising objection on the role of the SHO (Padukalan) Sunil Choudhary. Choudhary had handed over an adult woman to her parents against her wish despite the court’s directions to the police to provide her adequate security after she expressed threat from her parents. The girl had married against the wish of her parents and entered into wedlock after attaining the legal age of marriage. She appeared in the court thereafter and sought security from her parents by filing a criminal miscellaneous petition. “The court then directed her to submit an application to the SP (Nagaur) and the SP to provide him adequate security,” said the petitioner’s counsel Navneet Singh. The girl appeared before SHO Choudhary in April, who after recording her statements, handed her to her parents in violation of the court’s directions to provide her security from her parents. Taking a serious note of this dereliction of court’s direction, the court directed the DGP to take appropriate disciplinary action against the SHO Choudahry and sent the girl to the woman shelter home for the time being so that she could recover from the state of mental stress. On the next hearing on May 27, she will be produced before the court for further directions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bikaner hottest at 40.6 degrees Celsius.description: JAIPUR: After a prolonged spell of dust storm, rainfall and hailstorm, mercury took an upward swing across the state on Sunday. An average rise of almost 3 degrees Celsius in the day temperature was reported across the state. Bikaner remained hottest in the state with a maximum temperature of 40.6 degrees Celsius, the Met reports said. Attributing the climatic change to active northern winds, Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state except for northern Rajasthan where dust storm and rainfall will take place in the next 24 hours. Jaipurites woke up to a comparatively warmer morning as a minimum temperature of 24.5 degrees Celsius was recorded. It was followed by an afternoon with a maximum temperature of 38.8 degrees Celsius. Cloudy conditions prevailed in the evening and the weather was humid in the city. In this season so far the maximum temperature in the city was colder compared to the previous years. In Jaipur the average of the maximum temperatures recorded in May is 42.5, however in this year so far this has been 39.5 degrees Celsius. Except a few places, the weather is going to be dry in the state when maximum temperatures will further increase. In May the maximum temperatures in places like Churu, Sriganganagar and Bikaner touch 45 degrees Celsius, but this year so far this has been on or below 42 degrees Celsius. Bikaner was followed by Sriganganagar where a maximum temperature of 40.5 degrees Celsius was recorded, Kota 40.3, Jaisalmer 40.1, Churu 40, Barmer 39.8, Ajmer 39.5, Jodhpur 39.1 and in Udaipur a maximum temperature of 37.8 degrees Celsius was recorded. As per the forecast, dust storm, thunderstorm and rainfall will take place at few places in the state. The weather is going to be dry in the rest of the state. Congress warns leaders against making co.description: JAIPUR: As infighting in Rajasthan Congress is getting shriller after its humiliating defeat in the Lok Sabha elections, the party has cautioned its leaders against making any controversial statement that can be seen as an anti-party activity. Sending out a signal that attacks on the state leadership will be treated as indiscipline, the party has sought an explanation from Todabhim legislator P R Meena who had said that deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot should replace Ashok Gehlot as the chief minister following the party’s failure in Lok Sabha polls. AICC general secretary in-charge of Rajasthan, Avinash Pande said that partymen making irresponsible statements were furthering BJP’s negative agenda against Congress. “We only are furthering their (BJP) agenda of harming the Congress. In the party’s interest, it is our collective responsibility that we do not dent the party’s image; like disciplined soldiers we need to exhibit our unity under the adverse circumstances (rout in Lok Sabha polls),” Pande said in a statement released on Thursday. A day earlier, Congress legislator Meena had openly held chief minister Gehlot responsible for the party’s loss in Lok Sabha elections. For the second consecutive parliamentary elections, Congress drew a blank in Rajasthan, which has 25 Lok Sabha seats. “There is no public liking for Gehlot anymore. The Jats, Meenas, Gujjars and others are angry with him; then who will vote for us?” Meena had asked, while talking to reporters on Wednesday. Pande on Thursday asserted that Congress was still the country’s primary political party, though it is presently in power in just few states. “It is the responsibility of all Congressmen to maintain discipline and make no public statement directly or indirectly before the media or on social media that may imply that someone is trying to harm the party for personal benefit or is working on a personal agenda,” Pande said. Before MLA Meena, food and civil supplies minister Ramesh Meena had attacked Gehlot-government saying that the common man’s grievances were not being addressed as the bureaucracy was ruling the state. In fact, after a PCC executive committee meeting last week that approved the resolution asking Rahul Gandhi not to step down as Congress president, deputy CM Sachin Pilot had told media, “We would study and analyze why within 4-5 months after forming Congress government in the state, the people have chosen BJP (in Lok Sabha elections).” Early this week, Gehlot targeted Pilot—while talking to a Hindi news channel—by asking him to own responsibility for the party’s loss in Jodhpur Lok Sabha seat at least. After a series of controversial statements by Congressmen brought out infighting at top level in Rajasthan, state’s Congress in-charge Pande has urged party men not to get diverted by the “difficult circumstances” arising from the “present scenario” (Congress being reduced to low numbers in Lok Sabha). Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Here is a list of contituencies with prominent candiadates or clashes. One held for posting picture of Osian ML.description: JODHPUR: Police on Thursday arrested a person for posting the picture of Osian MLA Divya Maderna with an objectionable comment. A complaint against this post had been given to the police on Wednesday. According to the police, a complaint had been given by one Demaram on behalf of Maderna that some person had posted a picture of her with a groom and commented “Best wishes to the Osian MLA for tying nuptial knot. She stated that she had gone to attend a wedding function in village Jajiwal some time back where she had seated with the bride and groom for the snap. According to her, this photo of her sitting with the groom was made viral by some persons present at the wedding posing them as the couple. The miscreant also wished her for entering into wed-lock mentioning her in the comment with the picture on his Facebook account, which had further been shared by other users. He had also commented that she had been missing yesterday and married today. The original post read "kale lapta hi, aaj byanv kar liyo" in marwari. Meanwhile police has been searching for another person in the second complaint wherein a message on social media about her missing from her constituency asking for her whereabouts had been made viral. Police said that this complaint has been given against one Jugal and the police have been searching for him. Some posters in her constituency have recently been pasted wherein she had been said to be missing from her constituency since the election and sought information leading to her whereabouts. Constable among two held for Jalore murd.description: JODHPUR: Cracking a murder case, Jalore police on Friday arrested two persons including a female constable. One of the accomplices, her brother, who is also a constable in Sirohi, is absconding. All three had murdered one Bhajanlal Bishnoi and made it appear like a road accident. SP (Jalore) Kesar Singh Shekhawat said that initially, it appeared to be an accident but on investigation of the case followed by the complaint of the victim’s family members, it turned out to be a planned murder. “We have arrested a female constable Shravani Bishnoi and the vehicle driver Ashok Bishnoi for murdering Bhajanlal. Her brother and constable with the Sirohi Police, Suresh Bishnoi is absconding and the search for him is on,” said Shekhawat. It turned out during the investigation, that Shravani and the victim Bhajanlal had an affair. But she distanced herself from him after her selection in the police service. “Upset over the negligence, Bhajanlal made the photographs and videos of the couple viral on social media,” the officer said. Annoyed with this, Shravani in connivance of her brother, Suresh decided to eliminate Bhajanlal and hatched a plot under which, they created a fake facebook account in the name of Suman and honey-trapped Bhajanlal, who worked in Punjab. “After doing this, they called Bhajanlal on a pre-determined spot, Bhinmal-Bagoda Road on April 18 and hit him with a vehicle killing him on the spot,” Shekhawat said. For this, they engaged the vehicle of one Ashok Bishnoi in the name of election duty and attempted to forge documents of the vehicle to give an impression that it was possessed by some one else. “During the probe, we found that the victim had relations with a woman and this woman turned out to be Shravani,” Shekhawat said. He said that Suresh had gone to Hanumangarh on election duty but disappeared from there on learning about the cracking of the case and arrest of his sister. “We have been searching for him. After his arrest, more details could be obtained,” Shekhawat said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Furnish price details on housing project.description: JODHPUR: The Rajasthan High Court has directed the Rajasthan Housing Board (RHB) to provide complete price details in its brochure while launching any housing project in future. A single bench of Justice P S Bhati rejected some petitions pertaining to a RHB housing project in Bikaner’s Mukta Prasad Nagar in which the buyers challenged an additional demand of Rs 20 lakh over the actual roll out price at the time of giving physical possession of housing units, but directed the board to exercise caution in future. The petitioners argued that this demand was irrespective of the assurance by the board during launch of the scheme that there would not be any variation in the price more than 10% of the original price. The board, however, justifying the additional demand of Rs 20 lakh, attributed it to the expenditure incurred on sewerage network, water supply, road network and street lights like basic amenities. Board’s counsel argued that they had no alternative than to restructure the prices in view of providing these amenities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Avoid using pesticides for killing.description: JAIPUR: Chief wildlife warden of Rajasthan has written to the state agriculture department to avoid using pesticides for killing locusts in Jaisalmer which in turn is harming the Great Indian Bustard (GIB) which regularly feed on these insects. The wildlife department is also taking the help of scientists from Wildlife Institute of India (WII) to find a pesticide which just targets the locusts and doesn’t harm any other animal or bird. The letter (a copy of which is with TOI) states that pesticides being sprayed in Jaisalmer district to kill locusts has become a threat to the GIB particularly in Ramdeora, Lokarki and nearby areas since the state bird regularly feeds on this insect thus there is a threat to health of GIBs which consume them. The letter further urges the that not only the use of harmful pesticides should be avoided but suitable taxa specific bio pesticides maybe utilised for overcoming the locust’s problem without affecting the GIB. Talking to TOI, Arindam Tomar, chief wildlife warden, Rajasthan said, “The locusts cannot be allowed to multiply but at the same time it has to be ensured that GIBs are not affected because of the pesticides being used. We have sensitised the concerned authorities on the same.” GIB is listed as Schedule I species of Wildlife Protection Act 1972 and is defined as ‘critically endangered by the IUCN Red Data List with just over a 100 left. Keeping this in mind, the locusts issue becomes extremely serious, claim officials and environmentalists. Meanwhile the wildlife department has also been taking measures to curb the threat to the GIB. “A team from WII has reached Jaisalmer and few more would be arriving as well to find a solution to the problem. We are trying to find a pesticide which will only kill the locusts but not harm any other species. Controlling the locusts is also important but so is saving the GIB”, added Tomar. The field workers from the wildlife department have also been deployed to ensure that no GIB ventures into the areas where the pesticides are being sprayed to kill locusts. Steep rise in rape cases in Rajasthan co.description: JAIPUR: The number of rape cases registered from January to April this year have surpassed the horrifying figures witnessed last year during the same period. A total of 1,509 rape cases have been registered in past four months in Rajasthan this year, recording a significant high, compared to 1,312 cases in 2018 in the same period. The Alwar gang-rape case may have stirred the conscience of the state, but the figures indicate that successive governments have little to show up for women’s security, as rape cases have been steadily rising. The 15 per cent spike in the figures falls flat on the much-touted efforts by the government to curb crimes against women. There is also a very high pending percentage in rape cases reported this year. For instance, of the 1,509 cases registered this year, 858 cases are pending, while FR (Final Report) was submitted in 302 cases and chargesheets were filed in 349 cases. A senior police official attributed the steep rise in figures to high registration of the cases at the police stations. “For past four months, all police stations were told that no complainant should be turned down and an FIR must be registered without dilly-dallying. The increase in figure also shows that cases are being registered by the police,” official said, adding that decoy operations conducted by the PHQ led to the increase in cases. The police’ claims about cases being easily registered at police stations are contradicted by a series of events that followed soon after a young Dalit girl in Alwar was gang-raped by four men in front of her husband on April 26. Despite her constant pleadings, the police dragged its feet in filing the case, compelling her to go through worst ordeal which allowed the accused to make extortion calls to her. The gang-rape case offers a study of difficulties faced by rape-survivors in registering FIRs. “The government and the police have said multiple times that FIRs should be registered without delay, even if it means increase in numbers,” claimed the official, adding that a new deputy SP (DSP) rank official will be posted in each district for women’s security. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Boy blown to pieces after tinkering with.description: JAISALMER: A 12-year-old boy was blown to pieces while he was tampering with a bomb lying in a junkyard on Wednesday evening near RIICO colony in Pokhran city of Jaisalmer. The post-mortem was done by the medical board on Thursday. Explosives experts including those from Jodhpur reached spot and were investigating the matter. Pokhran SDO Anil Jain, Pokhran station officer Sukhram Vishnoi with his team reached the spot and are probing the case. According to Pokhran police, Lakshman (12), a resident of Ashapura slum, on Wednesday evening picked up the bomb while roaming in the industrial area. He was either trying to break it with a stone or burn it as a match box was found at the spot. In the process, the bomb exploded and the boy was blown to pieces. The explosion was heard for some distance and people rushed to the spot. When the boy did not reach home, his family started a search for him and found his mutilated body behind RIICO colony. Police was informed. They reached the spot and cordoned off the area after taking the body in their possession. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Crowdfunding raises hopes for visually i.description: JODHPUR: Hitesh, the 7-year-old son of a daily wager, who is visually impaired since birth, can now hope to see the colours of the world, thanks to online crowdfunding. Unable to proceed with his treatment due to the high cost, a crowd fund-raising platform has came to his rescue. An amount of Rs 25 lakh was raised in a matter of just two days through crowdfunding, after the initiation of a sympathiser associated with a fund-raising platform, who came into contact with Hitesh during his visit to Jodhpur over a month back. “His treatment has now begun in a hospital in Ghaziabad. Some tests are being done before arriving at any result about the treatment,” said Hemant Sharma, who, when he met Hitesh in Jodhpur, was very pained at the treatment the child was being meted out by his neighbours and felt like helping the family. Sharma said that since Hitesh had no vision since birth, he was not a ‘normal’ child and also had problem in balancing himself and this made him a laughing stock for others. A treatment of jaundice soon after birth had resulted in loss of vision. His father, a daily wager from Jodhpur, ran from pillar to post to get back the vision of his son but gave up soon, after spending his savings. “I went from government hospitals of Jodhpur to Ahmedabad, but nowhere did I receive any firm reply. I thought of visiting private hospitals but considering the cost of treatment there, I dropped the idea and left everything to god,” said his father Lalit Chawda. After coming into contact with Sharma, Hitesh was taken to an eye hospital in Ghaziabad where the doctors advised eye transplant and eye rectification surgery, which will cost Rs 25 lakh. “We started a campaign on the online fund-raising platform ImpactGuru and were successful in raising Rs 24.59 lakh in a matter of two days. A total of 1,898 donors have come forward from all parts of India to help Hitesh gain his vision and see the world through his eyes,” Sharma said. Piyush Jain of the platform said that the healthcare crowdfunding has emerged as an alternative method of raising funds online for medical expenses. In this the patients primarily rely on the social media networks to mobilise donors to finance the relevant medical bills. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman, mother run over and stoned to dea.description: JODHPUR: A man allegedly ran over a woman and her mother more than once and stoned them to death in Rajasthan's Jodhpur district on Thursday after her marriage was fixed with someone else, police said. The accused, Sukharam, jumped into a canal after the incident near Tiwari village of Osian area in the afternoon, the police said.  Prime facie, Sukharam had a relationship with the woman, Indra, and wanted to marry her. But Indra's mother, Dami Devi (45), fixed her marriage somewhere else, said deputy commissioner of police (East) Dharmendra Singh.  According to eyewitnesses, the three were seen talking inside the car, but suddenly the women got down and started walking. Sukharam then allegedly ran them over two-three times with his car and threw stones at them.  The accused then jumped into a canal after leaving his car nearby and is yet to be traced, the police said.  While Indra died on the spot, her mother succumbed to injuries en route to the hospital. The women, who are Pakistani migrants and had been living in the area for several years, are said to have obtained Indian citizenship in 2005, the police said.  "We have been searching for him in the canal using a net and other measures like controlling the water flow in the canal," Singh said.  A pair of slippers and a T-shirt with blood stains have been found near the canal. Witnesses are being interrogated in order to ascertain more facts about the incident. The son of the deceased is also being questioned for details, the DCP added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Western Rajasthan faces climate change p.description: JAIPUR: The desert districts are on the brink of a humanitarian crisis with the rise in surface temperature in Rajasthan. The excessive loss of water due to evaporation is leading to mass migration of people, livestock and desertification of the cropped land. To mark the world environemnt day, a Central Arid Zone Research Institute (CAZRI), Jodhpur shared its detailed report on the impact of rising temperature in the arid region says that one degree rise in temperature would increase the evapotranspiration by 35 mm to 96 mm. It translates into the additional water requirement of 1.57 lakh MLD water per annum to feed the irrigated land. The report studied the temperature, rainfall, surface heating, evapotranspiration and its sociological impact in districts including Barmer, Bikaner, Churu, Ganganagar, Hanumangarh, Jaisalmer, Jalore, Jhunjhunu, Jodhpur, Nagaur, Pali and Sikar. Highlighting the alacrity of the situation, Rajesh Goyal, principal scientist at CAZRI told TOI, “The total available groundwater for irrigation in the desert region is 3,516.9 MCM and increase of 1% in temperature will put additional stress of 44% on existing groundwater resources based on present land use pattern. The additional water requirement will put more groundwater zones into a dark category.” Rajasthan at present has 595 groundwater zones of which 268 zones are under the categories of grey and dark zones where the water has been utilised more than 65%. The drought every alternate year takes 10-15 years for any zone to hold water more than 50%. Globally evapotranspiration trends are projected for 5% to 10% increase with the increase in temperature by 2 to 5 degree Celsius. The rise in temperature has already started costing the farmers of these districts. The report says that with the rise of one degree temperature in Ganganagar would require about 276.19 MCM water and Hanumangarh would need 245.33 MCM water. “The additional water means, additional power and other resources making the sustainable living difficult. Ultimately, farmers are left with no option to opt of the farming due to the rising cost,” said Goyal. This factor further contributes to the migration of people. The sociologist had already pointed out that the first phase of migration which is men leaving their traditional means of livelihood for a living has started. “In no time, the men would be leaving their soil with their families and livestock which will eventually push them into poverty,” said Dr Zahida Shabnam, a historian on Rajasthani culture and tribes. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jodhpur dust storm: 3 dead, 1 injured in.description: JODHPUR: Three persons, including a pregnant woman, were killed while one other sustained serious injuries when a wall of an under-construction house adjacent to theirs collapsed due to intense dust storm near Masala Road area in Jodhpur late on Monday. The injured person is undergoing treatment at the MDM Hospital. Confirming the three casualties, district collector Prakash Rajpurohit said the victims had been sleeping on the roof of their house when the accident occurred. "The wall of an adjacent house, which was under-construction, collapsed due to dust storm and the debris fell on this family," said Rajpurohit. Those who died have been identified as Naini Devi (50), her son Vinod (23) and daughter-in-law Komal (25). Komal was pregnant. The three succumbed to their injuries at the hospital during treatment. Badly injured Manish, the husband of Komal, is undergoing treatment at the hospital. Administration is now probing whether the construction of the neighbour's house was legal or was there any negligence. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rajasthan\u2019s \u2018model\u2019 polic.description: JAIPUR/JODHPUR: Weeks after Jodhpur’s Basani police station was declared to be a ‘model’ police station, it finds itself surrounded in controversy after the Rajasthan Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Friday evening unearthed a major sand smuggling bribery racket operating from the station. An assistant sub inspector (ASI) posted there was also arrested even as the role of SHO Sanjay Bothra, who has been awarded commendation disc for his sharp skills and dedication to the uniformed service earlier in the day, is under scanner. ACB said that ASI Gajendra Singh Charan was arrested while accepting a bribe of Rs 20,000 for helping in releasing the vehicles. During interrogation, Charan said to have received the money at the behest of SHO Bothra. A senior official of the bureau informed TOI that they had received a complaint that some officials of the Basani police station were involved in sand smuggling case. “The accused ASI was arrested while accepting the bribe, however, when he sensed our presence, he threw the cash away and clambered above the station’s roof to flee before he was caught,” an ACB official informed TOI. The Rajasthan ACB said that they will also speak to SHO Sanjay Bothra about the case. Meanwhile, the incident has come as a major embarrassment for the Jodhpur police as Basani police station was touted as a “light house” for other stations. The PHQ was so impressed by the working of the police station that they designated it as a ‘model police station’ and exhorted other units including Jaipur police to emulate Basani police station’s working style. In fact, on Friday morning, the Rajasthan police had awarded a commendation disc to SHO Bothra for his “sharp management and technical skills, total dedication to the police duty, which has set a positive image of the police department in newspapers and television news.” Such was the clout of Basani police station that inspectors across the state visited Jodhpur to take notes and learn lessons from Bothra. Pilot should own up Jodhpur Lok Sabha lo.description: JAIPUR: In a development that marks worsening power struggle between top leadership in the state Congress, chief minister Ashok Gehlot has asked deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot to own responsibility for the party’s defeat in Jodhpur Lok Sabha seat. The chief minister was talking to a Hindi news channel on his party’s rout in Rajasthan in the just concluded parliamentary elections. On being asked if it was true that Pilot recommended Vaibhav Gehlot for the Jodhpur seat, Gehlot replied, “It’s a good thing if he (Pilot) says so. This dispels media reports about differences between the two of us.” Gehlot, however, added, “Pilot saab also said that we will win Jodhpur with a big margin, (because) we have six MLAs and our poll campaign was fabulous. So, I feel he should own responsibility for that seat at least. There should be a complete post-mortem of the Jodhpur seat to find out why we did not win it.” When the interviewer persisted if Gehlot truly believed that Jodhpur’s loss was Pilot’s responsibility, the chief minister replied, “He said that we were winning (from Jodhpur) and that he got the party ticket (for Vaibhav). But we lost all 25 seats. If someone says that the chief minister or the PCC chief should take responsibility for it, I believe it’s a collective responsibility.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jodhpur boy Pukhraj gives up cattle graz.description: JODHPUR: Bhomaram, a contract farm labourer from Tiwari town in Jodhpur, never thought education would lead him to anywhere. He gave up studies after Class 10th, partly due to his poor financial condition. Following in the footsteps, his son Pukhraj Berad did the same, got into cattle grazing, instead of pursuing senior secondary education. When the RBSE released Class 12th results on Wednesday, it was more than a celebration, not only for Pukhraj and his family, but also for Narsing Bhargava, the founder of a private school and the teachers there. Pukhraj secured 97.80% marks in science stream, 100 out of 100 in mathematics, 98 and 96 marks in chemistry and physics, respectively, while scoring the maximum in practicals. Bhargava feels as overjoyed as Pukhraj's poor parents because his belief in the boy paid off. It is he who saw him one day grazing cattle. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K".
