Congress embarrassed as party leaders op.description: JAIPUR: Rajasthan Congress is cracking under its own weight. The debacle in the Lok Sabha polls on May 23 has kicked up a storm in the party as its ministers, MLAs and leaders are taking on their own government, bureaucracy, cops and administration. They are hitting more headlines for opposing the government. Congress MLA and ex-DGP Harish Meena was staging sit-in against the Tonk police alleging murder when a tractor driver died. Meena found support in BJP leader, Rajya Sabha MP Kirori Lal Meena who shared the protest site with the former on Monday. This left the senior party leaders red-faced. Meena's own party leaders are denouncing his wisdom by calling it as an accident. However, later Meena called off his protest as the government agreed to his demands. Another front has been opened by cabinet minister Vishvendra Singh who is taking on police and administration for crimes in his constituency of Bharatpur. The minister alleged police of extorting money from traders and the locals. In a series of tweets from the past five days, he has been accusing the police of the same. Government took some corrective measures which failed to impress the minister. Singh has found support from BJP on his timeline causing embarrassment for party workers. TOI called Singh but he remained unavailable. Sources said that his ministerial colleagues have asked him to stop venting his anger in public but the minister refused to listen. In both the cases, the matter has not rung the bell at senior level where the party leaders did not show any urgency to resolve the issue. The party had also not been able to handle minister Lalchand Kataria’s resignation letter. The minister submitted his resignation on May 25 and was untraceable for the next four days. His letter reads that resignation has been sent to the CM and the governor. However, the government refused to admit about his resignation. In fact, it was not even aware of the minister’s whereabouts who surfaced at the CM’s residence on May 31. MLA from Dausa, Ramesh Meena had also hit the headlines after he publicly attacked the bureaucracy for not letting him carry out development works. Similarly, MLA from Nimbahera, Udailal Anjana questioned the party’s decision to field Vaibhav Gehlot from Jodhpur and failure to form an alliance with Hanuman Beniwal’s RLP. Both later assured that they are not against the party and aired their views in their personal capacity. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave hits life in parts of Rajasthan.description: JAIPUR: Blistering heat wave affected normal life in parts of Rajasthan where Bikaner recorded the highest temperature of 45.6 degrees Celsius on Tuesday. Jaipur Met office has said the heat wave conditions would intensify in eastern and western parts of the state in the next couple of days. Continued rise in mercury has further aggravated problems related to drinking water and power supply. In some parts of the state including Barmer, Ajmer, Bhilwara, Jodhpur, Churu, Bikaner and Jaisalmer, people are not getting drinking water on a regular basis. The district collectors concerned are arranging for water tankers for the public. In Jaipur, a minimum of 29.6 degrees Celsius was recorded, almost two degrees above normal. The city witnessed the hottest day of the season so far with maximum temperature of 43.2 degrees Celsius. Several colonies also witnessed abrupt power cuts due to increased usage in city. Bikaner was followed by Sriganganagar and Jaisalmer where a maximum temperature of 45.2 degrees Celsius was recorded, Churu 45.1, Kota 45 Barmer 44.6, Jodhpur 44.5, Ajmer 43.5 and a maximum of 41.8 degrees Celsius was recorded in Udaipur. The heat wave conditions will further aggravate in the state in the next 24 hours, Jaipur Met office said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Traffic cop booked for attacking wildlif.description: JODHPUR: A case has been registered against a traffic constable for allegedly attacking wildlife activists of village Sarecha under Luni police station in Jodhpur. He had allegedly been caught with a gun by the locals belonging to the Bishnoi Tiger Force on Monday midnight, while he was allegedly looking for an animal to hunt there. A video of the conflict between the policeman and the activists attempting to snatch his gun, has gone viral on social media. The constable, identified as Satyapal Singh, had been allegedly found in search of some animals for hunting, with an aide amidst the farms of the village with a double barrel gun. The villagers snatched the gun from him and informed the police and forest department. The gun was handed over to the police but the said accused managed to flee taking advantage of the night. The activists alleged that the policeman later attacked one of their men early on Tuesday morning injuring him and damaging his motorcycle. According to the Luni police, a case has been registered against Satyapal Singh under appropriate sections of IPC, which are 308 (attempt to commit culpable homicide), 324 (voluntarily causing hurt by weapon) and 341 (wrongful restraint). A counter case has also been registered against the activists on the complaint of the aide of the policeman, alleging causing them hurt and caste-based comments. In the morning, the activists of the Bishnoi Tiger Force (BTF) along with the villagers and wildlife lovers staged a demonstration at the Luni police station, exerting pressure on the police to take action in the matter and file a case against the accused policeman. Rampal Bhawad of the BTF said that despite giving all the information and catching him red-handed while he was in search of some animal to hunt with his gun, police did not register a case against their own man. “We had to sit on a demonstration at the Luni police station to force the police to register a case against the policeman,” said Bhawad. He demanded inquiry into the possession of the weapon by the accused despite the election code in force, stating that where did the weapon come from. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati. Review status of all dry rivers in Rajas.description: JODHPUR: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed chief secretary to review the status of all the dried rivers in the state and ensure that they are not misused for purpose of disposal of solid and liquid waste, on the pretext that these are dry rivers. The tribunal has also sought an affidavit to this effect in two months to be filed by the secretary, Irrigation and Flood Control Department of the state in consultation with all concerned departments and under the supervision of chief secretary. Along with this, DGP and additional DGP have also been directed to appear before the tribunal on the next date of hearing, with a proposal for constituting a Special Task Force to check activities of the industries functioning in contravention to the environmental laws and orders passed by tribunal from time-to-time. The tribunal gave these directions following the proceedings on monitoring the execution and compliance of its previous orders, which inter alia pertained to closing of two industries, setting up of Primary Effluent Treatment Plants (PETPs) by textile and steel industries, adoption of PETP standards, utilization of treated CETP effluents and sewage from sewage treatment plants, maintaining environmental flow in river Jojri and monitoring mechanism for execution of directions. The tribunal directed pollution control board to consider if the CETP is non-compliant with the standards, then all members of CETP are liable for closure till deficiency is rectified.
